Everybodyâ€™s Doing It!

Blogging about their goals for 2019! . I find that making goals works best for me, as they are more concrete than resolutions, which our friends at google state, is â€˜a firm decision to do or not to do somethingâ€™. Resolutions are something

Okay, enough with the New Yearâ€™s philosophy alreadyâ€¦ ðŸ™„

Anyway, this year should be exciting, as Iâ€™m not bound to a fixed location of work for 42.5 hours a week. With that said, Iâ€™ll still be using the traditional 40 hours a week to develop my skills and continue building projects.

Goals for 2019

Iâ€™ve divided my goals into directly career oriented goals and miscellaneous (mostly hobby and )

Software Engineering and Career Goals

  • Learn Typescript and incorporate it into personal stack (as a first challenge)
  • Find a paying freelance employer or project (in addition to what looks like a 60-80% time fixed contract for 2019. I should have the time for this)
  • Finally make a profitable side hustle! (Iâ€™m not sure if it will be software product or different products entirely, or another shot at an e-commerce store. I suppose since itâ€™s a fresh start this year, I have to be honest with myself about Siren Apparel. The bottom line is that nobody visits the site! Iâ€™m going to deactivate our Shopify subscription this month and leave up the website as a boutique made-to-order store.)
  • Earn at least $1000 through my Skillshare course(s) (If itâ€™s more obviously I will be very happy!)

Miscellaneous Goals

  • Read more (I even made a â€˜read 30 booksâ€™ goal on goodreads.com - Iâ€™ll aim for that first, but honestly it should be even more for all of 2019. I think this year I will start properly keeping track of my books on goodreads.com as well.)
  • Paint more (I made a few number of acrylic and watercolor pieces in 2017, but 2018 was a very slow year in terms of physical art. I published much more digital art in 2018](https://instagram.com/chriscreatesart).)
  • Record and publish at least 2 songs (Acquiring the bare minimum for a home studio was also new for me in 2018, at least in the last half of the year. Iâ€™m learning just how hard recording with a professional microphone is. It will take practice and some good song writing, but I am confident to release a few songs this year, more if there is time.)
